isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB DOOR COMPONENTS DISASSEMBLY AND REASSEMBLY - DOOR LATCH

svcprocinfo.para: The cab door latch and lock assembly ( Figure 42) features positive, no rattle type latching jaws which engage with a door striker pin on cab lock pillar. Latch assembly is made up of two halves, the latch and the lock, which mount to the edge of the door and connect to inner and outer operating handles, lock cylinder, and lock knob by relay control rods.

figure.caption: Figure 42. Door Latch and Lock Assembly

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para:
Remove lower door access panel. Refer to DOOR HARDWARE, TRIM AND ACCESS PANEL
.
Unscrew lock knob from relay control rod through window frame.
Unfasten relay rods (3) from latch assembly ( Figure 42).
Remove four slotted screws from latch and detach the latch and lock assembly from door.

svcsubproc.para: To remove the latching jaws only:

step1.para: Loosen screws retaining jaws to inner half of jaw assembly.
Move jaws from fixed position and insert a suitable drift punch into the screw hole that holds the inner half of the latch assembly.
Remove remaining screw and jaws from door.

svcsubproc.title: Install

step1.para: Install latch assembly into door and secure with screws.
Insert remote control rods into latch assembly and push into lock clips.
Operate latch assembly to assure correct assembly.
Screw lock knob onto relay control rod.

Install lower door access panel. Refer to DOOR HARDWARE, TRIM AND ACCESS PANEL
.
Place jaws in position and install (1) retaining screw. Do not tighten screw. Remove drift punch.

svcsubproc.para: It may be necessary to jiggle the drift punch to align the screw hole to start the screw.
